channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CA

item.title: Report E-2024050553
item.description:
Report E-2024050553

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-27T21:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-17
  • City: MONTEBELLO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 17, 2024, two (2) one-gallon pails of UN3149 were crushed in transit and released approximately one and a half (1.5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GME) to remediate the impacted site. GME personnel deployed granular absorbents to the UN3149-impacted dock floor and swept them in with hand tools. All damaged containers were set aside and placed into two (2) 55-gallon drums. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. All three (3) 55-gallon drums were staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024050358
item.description:
Report E-2024050358

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-22T15:12:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-02
  • City: CARSON
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 2, 2024, two (2) half-gallon cans of corrosive liquid were punctured by a forklift and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the cardboard boxes. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized cleaners and absorbents to remediate the site and containerized all impacted materials and the damaged cans in one (1) 55-gallon drum.
